tool.name: Align contigs and scaffolds
tool.command:
contiguator.py
##Inputs --ref_fasta=$ref_fasta ##Input reference genome in fasta format --contig_scaff_fasta=$contig_scaff_fasta ##Input contig or scaffold sequences in fasta format
## Check if using default or custom parameters --default_full_settings_type=$default_full_settings.settings_type #if $default_full_settings.settings_type == "full" --more_results=$default_full_settings.more_results --log_level=$default_full_settings.log_level ##Blast parameters --blast_evalue_threshold=$default_full_settings.blast_evalue_threshold ##Parse blast mode ##Not sure what these parameters do ##--parse_ready_made_blast_output=$default_full_settings.parse_ready_made_blast_output ##--blast_output_for_parsing=$default_full_settings.blast_output_for_parsing ##Contig profiling parameters --contig_minimal_length=$default_full_settings.contig_minimal_length --contig_minimal_coverage=$default_full_settings.contig_minimal_coverage --minimal_blast_hit_length=$default_full_settings.minimal_blast_hit_length --minimum_best_replicon_estimation_ratio=$default_full_settings.minimum_best_replicon_estimation_ratio ##Primer picking ##--do_primer_picking=$default_full_settings.do_primer_picking ##The next 2 params is commented out because of lack of documentation ##--use_default_params=$default_full_settings.use_default_params ##--compute_inner_primers=$default_full_settings.compute_inner_primers #end if
##Output --html_file=$html_file --html_file_files_path=$html_file.files_path

param.name: ref_fasta
param.label: Reference genome file in FASTA format

param.name: contig_scaff_fasta
param.label: Contig or scaffold file in FASTA format

param.name: settings_type
param.label: Contiguator settings to use
param.help: Default settings are suitable for most analyses. If you want full control, use Full parameter list

param.name: contig_minimal_length
param.label: Minimum length of contigs for analysis

param.name: contig_minimal_coverage
param.label: Minimum percentage of contig coverage for analysis

param.name: minimal_blast_hit_length
param.label: Minimum length of a Blast hit

param.name: minimum_best_replicon_estimation_ratio
param.label: Minimum ratio for a best replicon estimation

tool.help:
**What it does**
`CONTIGuator <http://contiguator.sourceforge.net>`_ is a Python script which can be used in the bacterial genome finishing process. It can be used to align and resolve the relative position of the contigs obtained with the latest sequencing technologies, and enable a set of PCR primers to be designed to fill in gaps towards finishing the assembly of genome. It also can be used to study the genome structure using the Artemis comparison tool (ACT).
CONTIGuator uses the megaBlast algorithm to create a so­called “contig profile”, where each contig and the regions of the reference genomes are divided into regions of high similarity. This results in an higher number of PCR primers, generated by a run of ABACAS using primer3 and Mummer.
The outputs of the program can be visualized with the ACT, where the user can obtain a clear insight into the structural genomic features of the draft genome (a result of the contig profiling step) and visualize the position and length of the putative PCR products. A publication­quality pdf map will be produced for each putative replicon.
-----
**How to use the tool**
All input sequences need to be in FASTA format.
-----
**Output**
The outputs of CONTIGuator are various files and they are divided by folders “Map” folders.
According to the number of input reference sequence replicons, there will be the same number of directories whose name starts with “Map”, followed by the ID of the reference replicon. Inside each directory is a series of files that can be used as input for ACT::
Reference.embl Pseudo­contig ACT file PseudoContig.fsa Pseudo­contig fasta file PseudoContig.crunch ACT comparison file PseudoContig.embl Pseudo­contig ACT file MappedContigs.txt Names and lengths of contigs mapped to the particular reference molecule
In addition, a PDF file containing the "manual" version of the map viewable with ACT is created.
In the full parameter list, Contiguator can be configured to output more information for each alignment between contig and reference sequences::
AlignDetails.tab Tab delimited file containing details about mapped hits AlignedContigsHits.fsa Fasta file containing mapped hits on contigs AlignedReferenceHits.fsa Fasta file containing mapped hits on reference UnAlignedContigsHits.fsa Fasta file containing unmapped regions on contigs UnAlignedReferenceHits.fsa Fasta file containing unmapped regions on reference. If the primer picking option was selected (­P), the folder will contain other files PCRPrimers.tsv Table containing details about the PCR primers generated “UnMappedContigs” folder
The UnMapped Contigs folder contains information about contigs that CONTIGuator was unable to map in fasta format::
Excluded.fsa All excluded contigs Multi.fsa Contigs mapped to more than one replicon Short.fsa Contigs below the length threshold NoCoverage.fsa Contigs below the coverage threshold CoverageBorderLine.fsa Contigs near the coverage threshold Discarded.fsa Contigs discarded due to duplicated hits UnMappedContigsHits.tab Contains the list of the excluded contigs with the number of tblastn hits UnMappedReferenceRegions.tab Contains the reference genome unmapped regions with at least one tblastn hit UnMappedContigs.txt Names and lengths of the contigs not mapped to any particular reference molecule
In addition to these files, a log file called CONTIGuator.log is present in the source directory. The amount of log output can be modulated within the full parameters settings.
The primer picking functionality has not been included in this wrapping of Contiguator.
-----
Please cite the following reference if you use this tool::
CONTIGuator:a bacterial genomes finishing tool for structural insights on draft genomes. Marco Galardini, Emanuele G Biondi, Marco Bazzicalupo and Alessio Mengoni. Source Code for Biology and Medicine 2011, 6:11 doi:10.1186/1751-0473-6-11
